channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Brexit: Staff shortages hitting supermarket shelves in Wales
item.description: Industry bosses say they cannot staff their workforces from within UK.

item.title: Boris Johnson: Tories feared PM would die with Covid, says Simon Hart
item.description: The Welsh secretary says there were concerns Boris Johnson would die when he was ill with Covid-19.

item.title: Greenham Common march from Cardiff recreated 40 years later
item.description: The 1981 march started years of protests against US nuclear missiles being stored at the air base.

item.title: Ration blood tests because of test tube shortage, GPs told
item.description: NHS Wales issues guidelines which include a temporary pause of a number of blood tests.

item.title: Gower: Power boat and water bike 'terrorise' swimmers
item.description: Mumbles Coastguard received complaints they were getting dangerously close to bathers at Langland Bay.

item.title: Covid: Free school meals pupils' diet hit by school closures
item.description: Some children ate less fruit and more takeaways during lockdown school closures, research finds.

item.title: Covid: Returning school pupils asked to take regular tests
item.description: The Welsh government issues guidance for all pupils returning to school in September.

item.title: Child, 3, seriously hurt in Pontypridd dog attack
item.description: Police said a member of the public stepped in to help the child in the attack at a country park.

item.title: Gavin and Stacey's Ruth Jones and Rob Brydon reunite in sitcom
item.description: The show follows two newlyweds honeymooning in the Scottish Highlands.

item.title: Pontneddfechan: Man drowned at waterfall after getting pulled under
item.description: Hermanta Rai was visiting the beauty spot with friends when he got into difficulties in the water.

item.title: Vale of Glamorgan councillor abused child for 10 years, trial hears
item.description: Former teacher Anthony Hampton denies abusing four children between the 1970s and 1990s.

item.title: Simon Hart: 'Thinking Boris could die was sobering moment'
item.description: Welsh Secretary Simon Hart talks about Prime Minister Boris Johnson's admission to intensive care with Covid.

item.title: Ex-RAF paramedic relieved 'vital' Afghan interpreter now in UK
item.description: Rachel Pompa speaks of her joy as an interpreter she worked with finally lands in the UK.

item.title: Water bike and boat pass 'terrified' swimmers at speed
item.description: Swansea Council is investigating the incident which made members of the public "very concerned".

item.title: Covid: Calls to investigate cost of travel tests in Wales
item.description: Tory MP David TC Davies says people in Wales should be able to shop around for a PCR test supplier.

item.title: Levelling up: Lessons from Rhyl on the changes needed
item.description: The BBC asks locals in the town of Rhyl how the government's levelling up agenda could help them.

item.title: Snowdon hectic with 24/7 tourists, say Llanberis residents
item.description: Residents say walkers have been trudging up and down to the peak around the clock.

item.title: Swansea City step up Covid precautions at Fairwood training ground
item.description: Swansea City are having to limit access to their training ground in an attempt to curb the club's Covid-19 cases.

item.title: Newport County 0-8 Southampton: Saints claim record win as they crush Exiles in EFL Cup
item.description: Southampton secure the biggest away win in their history as they hammer Newport County 8-0 at Rodney Parade in the EFL Cup.

item.title: Rugby League World Cup 2021: New dates announced for postponed tournament
item.description: Rugby League World Cup bosses announce new dates for the postponed 2021 tournament.

item.title: Aaron Ramsey: Wales braced for injury blow, but hope he can face Estonia
item.description: Wales hope Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey will be fit for their World Cup qualifier against Estonia in September.

item.title: Newcastle United 0-0 Burnley (3-4 pens): Wayne Hennessey saves send Clarets through
item.description: Wayne Hennessey has Burnley debut to remember as he saves two spot-kicks to help them beat Newcastle on penalties in the Carabao Cup.

item.title: Gweinidog yn 'gofidio' am gynnydd Covid mewn pobl dros 60
item.description: Daw wrth i feddyg ddweud bod ysbytai'n "orlawn" gyda phobl sydd angen triniaeth am bethau heblaw Covid.

item.title: Pryderon gofal yn sgil prinder tiwbiau profi gwaed
item.description: Canllawiau newydd i wneud profion yn llai aml, a blaenoriaethu cleifion risg uchel oherwydd prinder.

item.title: Ymgyrch i gyfieithu llyfrau awduron du i'r Gymraeg
item.description: Nod cynllun AwDUron yw sicrhau'r "amrywiaeth fwyaf erioed" o fewn llyfrau Cymraeg ar gyfer plant.

item.title: Darganfod Llwybrau Cymru: Tudweiliog
item.description: Dewch ar daith gerdded o Borth Colmon i Borth Tywyn ym Mhen-Llŷn.

item.title: Hoci iâ yn ôl yng Nghymru am y tro cyntaf ers 18 mis
item.description: Mae Devils Caerdydd yn paratoi am eu gêm gyntaf ers Mawrth 2020 yn erbyn Adler Mannheim o'r Almaen.
